name: Clinicians Data
info: Lab results and other values taken by the attending physicians.

variables.name: First and last name
variables.race: Values: Caucasian, Asian, African American, Hispanic, and other
variables.admission_type_id: Integer identifier corresponding to categories, for example, emergency, urgent, elective, newborn, and not available
variables.discharge_disposition_id: Integer identifier corresponding to categories, for example, discharged to home, expired, and not available
variables.admission_source_id: Integer identifier corresponding to categories, for example, physician referral, emergency room, and transfer from a hospital
variables.time_in_hospital: Integer number of days between admission and discharge
variables.medical_specialty: Integer identifier of a specialty of the admitting physician, corresponding to distinct categories, for example, cardiology, internal medicine, family/general practice, and surgeon
variables.num_lab_procedures: Number of lab tests performed during the encounter
variables.num_procedures: Number of procedures (other than lab tests) performed during the encounter
variables.num_medications: Number of distinct generic names administered during the encounter
variables.max_glu_serum: Indicates the range of the result or if the test was not taken. Values: '>200', '>300', 'normal' and 'none' if not measured
variables.A1Cresult: Indicates the range of the result or if the test was not taken. Values: '>8' if the result was greater than 8%, '>7' if the result was greater than 7% but less than 8%, 'normal' if the result was less than 7% and 'none' if not measured
variables.change: Indicates if there was a change in diabetic medications (either dosage or generic name). Values: “change” and “no change”
variables.diabetesMed: Indicates if there was any diabetic medication prescribed. Values: “yes” and “no”
variables.readmitted: Days to inpatient readmission. Values: “<30” if the patient was readmitted in less than 30 days, “>30” if the patient was readmitted in more than 30 days, and “No” for no record of readmission.
